section.title: Authentication Token Configuration
section.para: Token Service is used in authentication. The token system prevents user account information being sent in the clear text mode within inbound requests. This increases authentication security.

The token service allows administrators to create, delete, retrieve and clean tokens as required. The service also defines a validity period of any given token. The token becomes invalid once this period expires.

section.title: Implement the Token Service API
section.para: All token services used in the &PRODUCT; authentication must be implemented by subclassing an AbstractTokenService abstract class. The following AbstractTokenService methods represent the contract between authentication runtime, and a token service implementation.

section.title: Configure token services
section.para: The token services configuration includes specifying the token validity period. The token service is configured as a portal component (in the portal scope, as opposed to the root scope - See for more information).
In the example below, CookieTokenService is a subclass of AbstractTokenService, so it has a property which specifies the validity period of the token.
The token service will initialize this validity property by looking for an init-param named service.configuration.
This property must have three values.
In this case, the service name is jcr-token and the token expiration time is one week.
